data.name: AGED_FILES_INFO_TOSTRING_TEMPLATE
data.value: {{{0} (Per AgedFileInfo Instance: Base Name = {1},LastWriteTimeUTC = {2} ({3 Ticks}),LastWriteTime = {4} ({5 Ticks}))}}
data.comment: The ToString overload on the AgedFileInfo class constructs a message that conveys information that should be pertinent to someone who encounters it in the watch window of a debugger.

data.name: EMPTY_ALIAS_LIST
data.value: The list of aliases is empty.
data.comment: The CmdLneArgsBasic class uses this string to report an internal error.

data.name: ERRMSG_CANNOT_PARSE
data.value: ERROR: The CreateFormatString method cannot process the specified format string.{1} Specified format string = {0

data.name: ERRMSG_COMMA_AND_LITERAL
data.value: , and
data.comment: This substring was created for use with ERRMSG_UNRESLOVED_ENVIRONEMT_STRINGS.

data.name: ERRMSG_COMPARAND_IS_WRONG_TYPE
data.value: ERROR: The specified object is a {0}.{2}Type must be {1}.
data.comment: The ReportDetail class uses this error message in its exception reports.

data.name: ERRMSG_CONFIG_FILE_IS_EMPTY
data.value: The specified DLL configuration file, {0}, exists, but is empty.
data.comment: Classes derived from abstract class AssemblyLocatorBase class emit this message.

data.name: ERRMSG_CONFIG_PROP_NOT_FOUND
data.value: An exception occurred while processing the {0} property on a {1} object. Details are as follows: {2}
data.comment: The SetPropertiesFromDLLConfiguration method constructs an exception report, which it appends to the ConfigMessage string.

data.name: ERRMSG_DETAIL_FORMAT_CANNOT_BE_NULL_OR_BLANK
data.value: ERROR: The DetailFormat property cannot be a null reference or empty string.
data.comment: The ReportDetail class uses this error message in its exception reports.

data.name: ERRMSG_DISPLAY_ORDER_CANNOT_BE_ZERO
data.value: ERROR: The DisplayOrder property cannot be set to zero.
data.comment: The ReportDetail class uses this error message in its exception reports.

data.name: ERRMSG_DUPLICATE_SWITCH
data.value: Switch {0} with a default value of {1} is a duplicate.
data.comment: rivate CmdLneArgsBasic instance method DefineNewSwitch constructs an exception report from this template.

data.name: ERRMSG_EXCEPTION_IN_DEFINE_NEW_SWITCH
data.value: An {0} Exception was caught while attempting to define a switch named {1} with a default value of {2}.
data.comment: Private CmdLneArgsBasic instance method DefineNewSwitch constructs an exception report from this template.

data.name: ERRMSG_INTERNAL_ERROR_UNSUPP_ALG
data.value: An internal error has been detected in routine ReformatSysDate.{2}An unexpected FormattingAlgorithm of {0} has been encountered while processing the following input string:{2}{1}
data.comment: Static method FormattingAlgorithm formats an exception report from this template.

data.name: ERRMSG_INV_TZINFO
data.value: CORRUPTED SYSTEM REGISTRY: The GetDisplayTimeZone method found the specified key, but the corresponding Registry key is corrupted.{1} Specified ID = {0}
data.comment: The GetSystemTimeZoneInfo method emits this string as an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_MISSING_CONFIG_FILE
data.value: There is no valid configuration file for DLL file {0}.
data.comment: Classes derived from abstract class AssemblyLocatorBase class emit this message.

data.name: ERRMSG_NO_MEMORY
data.value: SYSTEM RESOURCE FAMINE: The GetDisplayTimeZone method ran out of memory.
data.comment: The GetSystemTimeZoneInfo method emits this string as an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_NULL_TZ_ID
data.value: INTERNAL ERROR: The GetDisplayTimeZone method let a null pstrTimeZoneID through to TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById.
data.comment: The GetSystemTimeZoneInfo method emits this string as an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_REPORT_ITEM_IS_NULL
data.value: ERROR: No value has been assigned to this object.
data.comment: The ReportDetail class uses this error message in its exception reports.

data.name: ERRMSG_REPORT_ITEM_IS_UNLABELED
data.value: ERROR: This detail object is incomplete. It needs a label.
data.comment: The ReportDetail class uses this error message in its exception reports.

data.name: ERRMSG_SECURITY
data.value: ACCESS VIOLATION: The GetDisplayTimeZone method cannot read the Registry keys where the time zone information is kept. The process has insufficient access permissions on that key.
data.comment: ACCESS VIOLATION: The GetDisplayTimeZone method cannot read the Registry keys where the time zone information is kept. The process has insufficient access permissions on that key.

data.name: ERRMSG_SPECIFIED_LABEL_IS_NULL_OR_BLANK
data.value: ERROR: Label property of a ReportDetail cannot be null or blank.
data.comment: The ReportDetails class uses this string as a template for an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_START_CHARACTER
data.value: starting at character position {0}{1}{2}
data.comment: This substring was created for use with ERRMSG_UNRESLOVED_ENVIRONEMT_STRINGS, and it will probably see lots more use, provided that I remember that it's here.

data.name: ERRMSG_THIS_REPORTITEM_IS_NULL
data.value: ERROR: The value of the report item labeled {0} has not been set.
data.comment: The ReportDetails class uses this string as a template for an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_TZ_NOT_FOUND
data.value: INTERNAL or DATA ERROR: The GetDisplayTimeZone method let a pstrTimeZoneID that isn't registered on this computer through to TimeZoneInfo.FindSystemTimeZoneById.{1} Specified ID = {0}
data.comment: The GetSystemTimeZoneInfo method emits this string as an exception report.

data.name: ERRMSG_UNLABELED
data.value: * UNLABELED *

data.name: ERRMSG_UNRESLOVED_ENVIRONEMT_STRINGS
data.value: INPUT ERROR: Specified input string {0}{2} contains {1} unresolved environment variable.{2}
data.comment: Static method ReportUnresolvedEnvironmentStrings uses this string as a message template. Strings ERRMSG_COMMA_AND_LITERAL, ERRMSG_VARIABLE_LITERAL, and ERRMSG_START_CHARACTER are used with it.

data.name: ERRMSG_VARIABLE_LITERAL
data.value: variable
data.comment: This substring was created for use with ERRMSG_UNRESLOVED_ENVIRONEMT_STRINGS.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_APPLICATION
data.value: Image is an EFI Application.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_BOOT_SERVICE_DRIVER
data.value: Image is a EFI Boot Service Driver.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_ROM
data.value: Image runs from a EFI ROM.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_EFI_RUNTIME_DRIVER
data.value: Image is a EFI Runtime Driver.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE
data.value: Image doesn't require a subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE_WINDOWS
data.value: Image is a native Win9x driver.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_OS2_CUI
data.value: Image runs in the OS/2 character subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_POSIX_CUI
data.value: Image runs in the Posix character subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_UNDEFINED_VALUE
data.value: The specified image subsystem ID, {0} is undefined.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_UNKNOWN
data.value: Unknown subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CE_GUI
data.value: Image runs in the Windows CE subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI
data.value: Image runs in the Windows character subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_GUI
data.value: Image runs in the Windows GUI subsystem.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: IMAGE_SUBSYSTEM_XBOX
data.value: Image runs on XBOX.
data.comment: This string corresponds to one of the fourteen image (Portable Executable) subsystem types.

data.name: INCREMENT_CANNOT_BE_ZERO
data.value: Must be greater than zero.
data.comment: The ReportDetails class uses this string as a value label in a report.

data.name: INCREMENT_PROPERTY_VALUE
data.value: Increment Property Value
data.comment: The ReportDetails class uses this string as a value label in a report.

data.name: LOCAL_AND_UTC_TIME_TEMPLATE
data.comment: Public static TimeDisplayFormatter.PrepareLocalAndUTCTimes constructs its output from this template and a pair of DateTime structures, the first of which is expected to represent local time, while the second represents UTC time.

data.name: PROCESSOR_AND_PROCESS_ARCHITECTURES
data.value: {2}Processor Architecture = {0}{2}Process Machine Word = {1} bits{2}
data.comment: Method BasicSystemInfoDisplayMessages.ShowArchitectureBits formats its message from this template.

data.name: SWITCH_IS_OFF
data.value: OFF
data.comment: The CmdLneArgsBasic class tests Boolean switch values against this literal, which signifies that the switch state is off (False).

data.name: SWITCH_IS_ON
data.value: ON
data.comment: The CmdLneArgsBasic class tests Boolean switch values against this literal, which signifies that the switch state is on (True).

data.name: SYNCROOT_TOSTRING_TEMPLATE
data.comment: The first format item is enclosed in brackets, which must be doubled to escape them.

data.name: TDF_INVALID_ARG_VALUE
data.value: The value of {1} specified for argument {0} is invalid.
data.comment: The InvalidEnumArgValueMessage method of class TimeDisplayFormatter constructs an error message from this template.

data.name: TDF_INVALID_ENUM_VALUE
data.value: The new value of {1} specified for the {0} property is invalid.{3}The previous value of {2} is retained.
data.comment: The InvalidEnumValueMessage method of class TimeDisplayFormatter constructs an error message from this template.

data.name: TIME_LABEL_LOCAL_LONG
data.value: Local

data.name: TIME_LABEL_LOCAL_SHORT
data.value: LOC

data.name: TIME_LABEL_UTC
data.value: UTC
